title: Invaluable Take-aways from the Scientific Program Await You
cleaned_text: | | Register today to take advantage of this scientifically intensive conference in allergy and immunology this year. Allergy Matters at WISC 2016! Juan Carlos Celedón, MD, DrPH, Chief of Service, Division of Pediatric Pulmonology, Allergy and Immunology, Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh of University of Pittsbugh Medical School, Pennsylvania, USA What are you looking forward to at WISC 2016? Intellectual exchange and networking with esteemed colleagues. What new findings or insights can attendees look forward to in your session? I will present the latest findings from our ongoing research on stress and asthma in children and adults, emphasizing novel discoveries in genetics and epigenetics. Attend the Symposium Session of Dr. Celedón: Wednesday, 7 December 2016 16:30 - 17:35 Symposium: Beyond Pharmacotherapy: Role of Lifestyle Modification in Managing Asthma as Human Condition in the Age of Technology and Outcomes Session: "Genetics and Epigenetics of Stress and Asthma" Recent Publication: [Post-traumatic stress disorder, bronchodilator response and incident asthma in World Trade Center rescue and recovery workers.](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27548615) Did you know... In Israel, it is hard to walk more than a few blocks without spotting a juice stand. Juice stands offer a variety of freshly squeezed fruit and vegetable blend juices. Oranges, apples, pineapples and carrots are commonly found at every stand. Some stands will offer vegetable blends including beets, spinach, and tomatoes while cilantro, mint leaves, parsley, and ginger are also common ingredients that are available. In the fall and winter months, fresh pomegranate is in season and is frequently used. To learn more about food and drink in Israel, visit the [Israel Ministry of Tourism Website](http://goisrael.com/Tourism_Eng/Tourist%20Information/Discover%20Israel/Pages/Food%20and%20wine.aspx).
